resources.string: Apply to system apps too? Select \"No\" if unsure.

Downgrade is not possible without root or ADB
Backup name should not start with a digit nor should it contain any space. Leave it empty if you want to use current date-time.
Adding a preset for backup options removes the burden of selecting flags every time you backup/restore.
Click to allow AM to use OpenPGP

The existing data will be lost.
If you have turned off signature verification, you can use the Only install option to install the app without losing data.
Tap to view or send in signatures not yet present in App Manager\'s database of libraries.
Tap to submit the crash report.
The profile name cannot contain any spaces.
Display a list of users to select before installing an external app. Requires root or ADB.
Allow the profile to be used in the routine operations
If enabled, apps will be disabled/enabled based on the value of the state
If enabled, apps will be force-stopped
If enabled, cache will be cleared from the apps
If enabled, data will be cleared from the apps
If enabled, trackers will be blocked from apps
If enabled, apk files will be backed up
Custom on/off state for this profile
Input permissions with spaces, e.g. (com.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS android.permission.ACCESS_MEDIA_LOCATION) etc.
Sign APK files before installing them.
Set signature schemes, custom signing key, etc.
At least v1 and v2 schemes should be selected for a greater compatibility. v4 scheme requires v2 or v3.
Insert App Manager KeyStore password. If you\'re seeing this for the first time, please use a password generator to generate a password and save it in a secure place before inserting it here.
Tap here to provide KeyStore password
Insert password for the alias %1$s. You can leave this empty if the password is the same as the KeyStore password.
No permission to display app ops
Not all apps will work after a restore. Restoring KeyStore doesn\'t work on most devices.
Basic device info including Android system, CPU, GPU, RAM, Battery, etc.
Back up the entire source directory.
Back up only the APK files from the source directory. Source must be selected for this to work.
Back up data folders. If selected, internal data folders will be backed up by default.
Back up external data folders. Data must be selected for this to work.
Back up OBB and media folders.
Do not back up cache, no_cache and no_backup folders.
Back up app permissions, battery saving, data usage options, MagiskHide status, etc.
Back up rules configured within App Manager.
Use a separate named back up instead of base backup.
Useful for restoring backups which are failing due to checksum verification failure or has a different APK signature than the backed up one.
It sets the mode ignore to the following app ops: RUN_IN_BACKGROUND (from Android 7.0) and RUN_ANY_IN_BACKGROUND (from Android 9).
Intercepts communication among apps via Intent
Select the volume or disk where the backups will be stored.
Could not find any volumes with write permission.
Perform backups only for the specified users
Back up all the installed apps.
Back up apps without any previous backups.
Check integrity of the previous backups and redo backups for which the integrity checkup fails.
Redo backup for installed apps with previous backups.
Redo backups for apps with changes since the last backup. They include changes in size, version, last launch time.
Restore base backup from all backed up apps.
Restore base backup for apps that are not currently installed.
Restore already installed apps whose version codes are higher than the installed version code.
The APKM file is DRM-free, no need to convert it to APKS.
Lock App Manager using Android screen lock
